DataElement.preferredName: Patient Fertility Preservation Prior To Enrollment Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no response that asks if a patient had fertility preservation prior to study entry.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Fertility Preservation Prior To Enrollment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._The ability of an individual to produce offspring._The activity of protecting something from loss or danger; a process that saves organic substances from decay; to maintain or keep intact._Earlier in time or order._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: The ability of an individual to produce offspring.:The activity of protecting something from loss or danger; a process that saves organic substances from decay; to maintain or keep intact.:Earlier in time or order.:Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.:The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.

Concepts.definition: The ability of an individual to produce offspring.
The activity of protecting something from loss or danger; a process that saves organic substances from decay; to maintain or keep intact.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the patient's ability to conceive or nurse offspring and/or their current reproductive status.
